page.title: 15History of Pickering 2
page.content: In Celtic times the Gavrantuici tribe used their Celtic ploughs to tackle the soils of the lower slopes, establishing some of the farms which later grew into villages. Pickering is thought to have been founded in 270B.C.King Pederus founded the town called Pickering where he is also buried.Some people say his tomb is in the large Howe cut into by the road at Raincliffe. The celts were followed by the Bronze Age.These people built standing stone circles at Blakey Topping,Hutton Bushell,Wykeham and Farndale.Their barbed arrow heads show that hunting was sustained alongside pastoral farming and much of the forest was felled by them.
